headline.main: Putting the Gym Back In Gym Class

docs.lead_paragraph: PHIL LAWLER, a longtime physical education teacher, used to try to transform all his middle-school students, even the pudgy or uncoordinated ones, into athletes. He taught them to play basketball and baseball and ran them through drills to improve their game. But his priorities have since shifted away from sports skills. ''Our ultimate goal now is health and fitness,'' he said.
docs.snippet: Schools are increasingly taking a total wellness approach to what used to be the rough-and-tumble hour of a child's day.

docs.lead_paragraph: To the Editor: Re ''Serious Riders, Your Bicycle Seat May Affect Your Love Life'' (Oct. 4): Millions of American men and women ride bicycles for fun, health, transportation, conservation and sanity. Yes, some male cyclists experience sexual health problems. But they are a very small percentage of the cycling population.
